com.netflix.spectator.api

Interface LongTaskTimer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Meter
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LongTaskTimer

    public interface LongTaskTimer
extends Meter
    Timer intended to track a small number of long running tasks. Example would be something like a batch hadoop job. Though "long running" is a bit subjective the assumption is that anything over a minute is long running.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int activeTasks()
      Returns the current number of tasks being executed.
      long duration()
      Returns the cumulative duration of all current tasks in nanoseconds.
      long duration(long task)
      Returns the current duration for a given active task.
      long start()
      Start keeping time for a task and return a task id that can be used to look up how long it has been running.
      long stop(long task)
      Indicates that a given task has completed.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.netflix.spectator.api.Meter

        hasExpired, id, measure

    • Method Detail

      • start

        long start()
        Start keeping time for a task and return a task id that can be used to look up how long it has been running.

      • stop

        long stop(long task)
        Indicates that a given task has completed.
        Parameters:
        task - Id for the task to stop. This should be the value returned from start().
        Returns:
        Duration for the task in nanoseconds. A -1 value will be returned for an unknown task.

      • duration

        long duration(long task)
        Returns the current duration for a given active task.
        Parameters:
        task - Id for the task to stop. This should be the value returned from start().
        Returns:
        Duration for the task in nanoseconds. A -1 value will be returned for an unknown task.

      • duration

        long duration()
        Returns the cumulative duration of all current tasks in nanoseconds.

      • activeTasks

        int activeTasks()
        Returns the current number of tasks being executed.
